required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Using Peer Mentors to Support PACT Team Efforts to Improve Diabetes Control
clinical_study.official_title: Using Peer Mentors to Support PACT Team Efforts to Improve Diabetes Control

lead_sponsor.agency: VA Office of Research and Development

clinical_study.source: VA Office of Research and Development

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to test the effectiveness of a peer mentor model in a mixed race population of poorly controlled diabetic Veterans. Also, the study aims to assess the effects of becoming a mentor on those who originally were mentees. It is expected that participants in the peer mentoring arms (Arm 2 and 3) will have improved glucose control regardless of race or ethnicity at the end of the intervention.

detailed_description.textblock:
The primary objectives of this study are: (1) test the long-term effectiveness of a peer mentor model on improving glucose control, blood pressure, LDL levels, diabetes mellitus quality of life, and depression scores in a mixed race population of poorly controlled diabetic Veterans; (2) test the effectiveness of using former peer mentees as peer mentors as a means of creating a self-sustaining program; and (3) and test the effects of becoming a mentor on those who were originally mentees given a growing literature that being a mentor is good for your health. Secondary objectives include: (1) in those randomized to being a mentee, explore mentor characteristics associated with improved HbA1c.
This study will be a prospective randomized controlled trial. Outcomes to be measured include glycosylated hemoglobin, blood pressure, direct LDL, diabetes quality of life and depression.
The trial has two phases. In phase one, patients with poorly controlled diabetes are randomized to usual care or receiving peer mentoring. In phase two, poorly controlled diabetics are randomized to usual care or receiving peer mentoring from former mentees. Former mentees from phase 1 are also randomized such that they will have a 50% chance of becoming a mentor.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Glucose Control (Stage 1: Usual Care v. Peer Mentoring)
primary_outcome.description: Measured by change in HbA1c, adjusted for baseline HbA1c and patient random effects. HbA1c is measured as a percent. Values of the change variable (difference of 2 percentages) can be positive or negative. Negative change, which shows better outcome, occurs when the 6 month HBA1c is lower than the baseline HbA1c. (Change = final measure - initial measure)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Glucose Control (Stage 2: Usual Care v. Mentees)
primary_outcome.description: Measured by change in HbA1c, adjusted for baseline HbA1c and patient random effects. HbA1c is measured as a percent. Values of the change variable (difference of 2 percentages) can be positive or negative. Negative change, which shows better outcome, occurs when the 6 month HBA1c is lower than the baseline HbA1c. (Change = final measure - initial measure)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Glucose Control (Stage 2: Non-mentors v. Mentors)
primary_outcome.description: Measured by change in HbA1c, adjusted for baseline HbA1c and patient random effects. HbA1c is measured as a percent. Values of the change variable (difference of 2 percentages) can be positive or negative. Negative change, which shows better outcome, occurs when the 6 month HBA1c is lower than the baseline HbA1c. (Change = final measure - initial measure)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Direct LDL Blood Levels
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by change in Direct LDL blood levels, adjusted for baseline LDL and patient random effect. LDL is measured as mg/dL. Values of the change variable (difference of 2 levels) can be positive or negative. Negative change, which shows better outcome, occurs when the 6 month LDL is lower than the baseline LDL. (Change = final measure - initial measure)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Systolic Blood Pressure
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by change in systolic Blood Pressure, adjusting for baseline blood pressure and patient random effect. Systolic BP is measured as mmHG. Values of the change variable (difference of 2 levels) can be positive or negative. Negative change, which shows better outcome, occurs when the 6 month BP is lower than the baseline BP. (Change = final measure - initial measure)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Diabetes Quality of Life Score
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Diabetes Distress Scale, adjusted for baseline score and patient random effects. The DDS score is calculated by averaging 2 5-point Likert scale questions, and ranges from 1 to 5, where lower means less distress. Values of the change variable can be positive or negative. Negative change, which shows better outcome, occurs when the 6 month DDS is lower than the baseline DDS. (Change = final measure - initial measure)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Depression Symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by change in the Patient Health Questionnaire-2, adjusted for baseline score and patient random effects. The PHQ score is calculated by summing 2 4-point 0-3 Likert scale questions, and ranges from 0 to 6, with lower score indicating lower depression. Values of the change variable can be positive or negative. Negative change, which shows better outcome, occurs when the 6 month PHQ is lower than the baseline PHQ. (Change = final measure - initial measure)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Glucose Control
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by change in HbA1c, adjusted for baseline HbA1c and patient random effects. HbA1c is measured as a percent. Values of the change variable (difference of 2 percentages) can be positive or negative. Negative change, which shows better outcome, occurs when the 12 month HBA1c is lower than the baseline HbA1c. (Change = final measure - initial measure)

arm_group.description: Enrolled in two different time frames. No interventions will be provided to this arm. They will complete planned surveys, and blood draws (baseline, 6 months, and 12 months).

Participants in this arm will be mentored for 6 months by a veteran who was once in poor control but is now in good control. They will then be further randomized to either becoming a mentor for 6 months or having no other additional active intervention. All participants in this arm will be evaluated in person at baseline, 6 months, 12 months, and 18 months.
Participants in this arm will be mentored by the former mentee for 6 months and will be followed in person for an additional 6 months after the completion of the active intervention.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All participants must have a diagnosis of Type 2 diabetics.
- Diabetes began after age 30
- Mentees: Have an HbA1c > 8% on 2 different occasions in the course of 24 months, with at least one measure within 3 months of enrollment
- Mentors for Phase 1: Had an HbA1c of > 8% in the past 3 years and an HbA1c < (or equal to) 7.5% within 3 months of enrollment
- Mentors for Phase 2: Former mentee
Exclusion Criteria:
Exclusion Criteria:
- Does not speak English
- Unable to understand consents
- Severe speech impediment
- over the age of 75

group.title: Stage 1 Usual Care
group.description: Poorly controlled diabetics randomized to no intervention will complete planned surveys, and blood draws (baseline, 6 months, and 12 months).

group.title: Stage 1 Peer Mentoring
group.description: Poorly controlled diabetics randomized to intervention will be mentored for 6 months by a veteran who was once in poor control but is now in good control. For stage 2, they will then be further randomized to either becoming a mentor for 6 months or having no other additional active intervention. All participants in this arm will be evaluated in person at baseline, 6 months, 12 months, and 18 months.

group.title: Stage 2 Usual Care
group.description: Poorly controlled diabetics randomized to stage 2 no intervention will complete planned surveys, and blood draws (baseline, 6 months, and 12 months).

group.title: Stage 2 Peer Mentoring FFM (From Former Mentee)
group.description: Poorly controlled diabetics randomized to stage 2 intervention will be mentored by the former mentee for 6 months and will be followed in person for an additional 6 months after the completion of the active intervention.

group.description: Poorly controlled diabetics randomized to intervention will be mentored for 6 months by a veteran who was once in poor control but is now in good control. For stage 2, they will then be further randomized to either becoming a mentor for 6 months or having no other additional active intervention. All participants in this arm will be evaluated in person at baseline, 6 months, 12 months, and 18 months.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Mixed methods ANCOVA with patient random effects, to compare change in HbA1c from baseline to 6 months between treatment and control groups.
analysis.p_value_desc: Subject random effect included because same model was used for analyses of 2 separate follow up periods (baseline to 6 month, and baseline to 12 month, reported separately).
analysis.method_desc: Multiple imputation used for intent-to-treat analysis.
analysis.estimate_desc: Negative parameter estimate means decrease in HbA1c was greater for treatment group than for control group.

outcome.population: After 6 month of Stage 1, patients who were randomized to receive mentoring in Stage 1 were further randomized to either become a mentor in Stage 2 (Stage 2 Mentor) or to not become a mentor in Stage 2 (Stage 2 Non-mentor). Note that only those who had a 6-month follow-up visits for Stage 1 could be randomized to Stage 2 (139 participants).

group.title: Stage 2 Non-mentor
group.description: Patients who received peer mentoring in stage 1 who were randomized to no further treatment.

group.title: Stage 2 Mentor
group.description: Patients who received peer mentoring in stage 1 who were randomized to become mentors to poorly controlled diabetics.

Values of the change variable (difference of 2 levels) can be positive or negative. Negative change, which shows better outcome, occurs when the 12 month LDL is lower than the baseline LDL. (Change = final measure - initial measure)

outcome.title: Change in Systolic Blood Pressure
outcome.description: Measured by change in systolic Blood Pressure, adjusting for baseline blood pressure and patient random effect. Systolic BP is measured as mmHG. Values of the change variable (difference of 2 levels) can be positive or negative. Negative change, which shows better outcome, occurs when the 12 month BP is lower than the baseline BP. (Change = final measure - initial measure)

group.title: Stage 1 Usual Care
group.description: Poorly controlled diabetics randomized to no interventions will complete planned surveys, and blood draws (baseline, 6 months, and 12 months).

group.title: Stage 1 Peer Mentoring
group.description: Poorly controlled diabetics randomized to intervention will be mentored for 6 months by a veteran who was once in poor control but is now in good control.

measure.title: Change in Systolic Blood Pressure
measure.description: Measured by change in systolic Blood Pressure, adjusting for baseline blood pressure and patient random effect. Systolic BP is measured as mmHG. Values of the change variable (difference of 2 levels) can be positive or negative. Negative change, which shows better outcome, occurs when the 12 month BP is lower than the baseline BP. (Change = final measure - initial measure)

outcome.title: Change in Diabetes Quality of Life
outcome.description: Change in Diabetes Distress Scale, adjusted for baseline score and patient random effects. The DDS score is calculated by averaging 2 5-point Likert scale questions, and ranges from 1 to 5, where lower means less distress. Values of the change variable can be positive or negative. Negative change, which shows better outcome, occurs when the 12 month DDS is lower than the baseline DDS. (Change = final measure - initial measure)

group.title: Stage 1 Usual Care
group.description: Poorly controlled diabetics randomized to no interventions will complete planned surveys, and blood draws (baseline, 6 months, and 12 months).

group.title: Stage 1 Peer Mentoring
group.description: Poorly controlled diabetics randomized to intervention will be mentored for 6 months by a veteran who was once in poor control but is now in good control.

measure.title: Change in Diabetes Quality of Life
measure.description: Change in Diabetes Distress Scale, adjusted for baseline score and patient random effects. The DDS score is calculated by averaging 2 5-point Likert scale questions, and ranges from 1 to 5, where lower means less distress. Values of the change variable can be positive or negative. Negative change, which shows better outcome, occurs when the 12 month DDS is lower than the baseline DDS. (Change = final measure - initial measure)

outcome.title: Change in Depression Symptoms
outcome.description: As measured by change in the Patient Health Questionnaire-2, adjusted for baseline score and patient random effects. The PHQ score is calculated by summing 2 4-point 0-3 Likert scale questions, and ranges from 0 to 6, with lower score indicating lower depression. Values of the change variable can be positive or negative. Negative change, which shows better outcome, occurs when the 12 month PHQ is lower than the baseline PHQ. (Change = final measure - initial measure)

group.title: Stage 1 Usual Care
group.description: Poorly controlled diabetics randomized to no interventions will complete planned surveys, and blood draws (baseline, 6 months, and 12 months).

group.title: Stage 1 Peer Mentoring
group.description: Poorly controlled diabetics randomized to intervention will be mentored for 6 months by a veteran who was once in poor control but is now in good control.

measure.title: Change in Depression Symptoms
measure.description: As measured by change in the Patient Health Questionnaire-2, adjusted for baseline score and patient random effects. The PHQ score is calculated by summing 2 4-point 0-3 Likert scale questions, and ranges from 0 to 6, with lower score indicating lower depression. Values of the change variable can be positive or negative. Negative change, which shows better outcome, occurs when the 12 month PHQ is lower than the baseline PHQ. (Change = final measure - initial measure)

outcome.title: Change in Direct LDL Blood Levels (Stage 2: Usual Care v. Mentees)
outcome.description: Measured by change in Direct LDL blood levels, adjusted for baseline LDL and patient random effect. LDL is measured as mg/dL. Values of the change variable (difference of 2 levels) can be positive or negative. Negative change, which shows better outcome, occurs when the 6 month LDL is lower than the baseline LDL. (Change = final measure - initial measure)

group.title: Stage 2 Usual Care
group.description: Poorly controlled diabetics randomized to stage 2 no intervention will complete planned surveys, and blood draws (baseline, 6 months, and 12 months).

group.title: Stage 2 Peer Mentoring FFM (From Former Mentee)
group.description: Poorly controlled diabetics randomized to stage 2 intervention will be mentored by the former mentee for 6 months and will be followed in person for an additional 6 months after the completion of the active intervention.

measure.title: Change in Direct LDL Blood Levels (Stage 2: Usual Care v. Mentees)
measure.description: Measured by change in Direct LDL blood levels, adjusted for baseline LDL and patient random effect. LDL is measured as mg/dL. Values of the change variable (difference of 2 levels) can be positive or negative. Negative change, which shows better outcome, occurs when the 6 month LDL is lower than the baseline LDL. (Change = final measure - initial measure)

outcome.description: Measured by change in systolic Blood Pressure, adjusting for baseline blood pressure and patient random effect. Systolic BP is measured as mmHG. outcome.title: Change in Direct LDL Blood Levels (Stage 2: Non-mentors v. Mentors)
outcome.description: Measured by change in Direct LDL blood levels, adjusted for baseline LDL and patient random effect. LDL is measured as mg/dL. Values of the change variable (difference of 2 levels) can be positive or negative. Negative change, which shows better outcome, occurs when the 6 month LDL is lower than the baseline LDL. (Change = final measure - initial measure)
outcome.population: After 6 month of Stage 1, patients who were randomized to receive mentoring in Stage 1 were further randomized to either become a mentor in Stage 2 (Stage 2 Mentor) or to not become a mentor in Stage 2 (Stage 2 Non-mentor). Note that only those who had a 6-month follow-up visits for Stage 1 could be randomized to Stage 2 (139 participants).

group.title: Stage 2 Non-mentor
group.description: Patients who received peer mentoring in stage 1 who were randomized to no further treatment.

group.title: Stage 2 Mentor
group.description: Patients who received peer mentoring in stage 1 who were randomized to become mentors to poorly controlled diabetics.

measure.title: Change in Direct LDL Blood Levels (Stage 2: Non-mentors v. Mentors)
measure.description: Measured by change in Direct LDL blood levels, adjusted for baseline LDL and patient random effect. LDL is measured as mg/dL. The PHQ score is calculated by summing 2 4-point 0-3 Likert scale questions, and ranges from 0 to 6, with lower score indicating lower depression. Values of the change variable can be positive or negative. Negative change, which shows better outcome, occurs when the 12 month PHQ is lower than the baseline PHQ. (Change = final measure - initial measure)
outcome.population: After 6 month of Stage 1, patients who were randomized to receive mentoring in Stage 1 were further randomized to either become a mentor in Stage 2 (Stage 2 Mentor) or to not become a mentor in Stage 2 (Stage 2 Non-mentor). Note that only those who had a 6-month follow-up visits for Stage 1 could be randomized to Stage 2 (139 participants).

group.title: Stage 2 Non-mentor
group.description: Patients who received peer mentoring in stage 1 who were randomized to no further treatment.

group.title: Stage 2 Mentor
group.description: Patients who received peer mentoring in stage 1 who were randomized to become mentors to poorly controlled diabetics.

measure.title: Change in Depression Symptoms (Stage 2: Non-mentors v. Mentors)
measure.description: As measured by change in the Patient Health Questionnaire-2, adjusted for baseline score and patient random effects. The PHQ score is calculated by summing 2 4-point 0-3 Likert scale questions, and ranges from 0 to 6, with lower score indicating lower depression. Values of the change variable can be positive or negative. Negative change, which shows better outcome, occurs when the 12 month PHQ is lower than the baseline PHQ. (Change = final measure - initial measure)
measure.population: After 6 month of Stage 1, patients who were randomized to receive mentoring in Stage 1 were further randomized to either become a mentor in Stage 2 (Stage 2 Mentor) or to not become a mentor in Stage 2 (Stage 2 Non-mentor). Note that only those who had a 6-month follow-up visits for Stage 1 could be randomized to Stage 2 (139 participants).

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data were collected for 18 months from baseline.

group.title: Usual Care Stage 1
group.description: No interventions will be provided to this arm. They will complete planned surveys, and blood draws (baseline, 6 months, and 12 months).

group.title: Peer Mentoring
group.description: Participants in this arm will be mentored for 6 months by a veteran who was once in poor control but is now in good control. They will then be further randomized to either becoming a mentor for 6 months or having no other additional active intervention. All participants in this arm will be evaluated in person at baseline, 6 months, 12 months, and 18 months.

group.title: Peer Mentoring FFM (From Former Mentee)
group.description: Participants in this arm will be mentored by the former mentee for 6 months and will be followed in person for an additional 6 months after the completion of the active intervention.

group.title: Usual Care Stage 2
group.description: No interventions will be provided to this arm. They will complete planned surveys, and blood draws (baseline, 6 months, and 12 months).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
